sen.j: 安斗阿加布（あとのあかふ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: ATO no Akafu is a person who lived in the Asuka Period, but his birth and death dates are not known.
ATO no Akafu is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka period, but his birth and death dates are not known.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: ATO no Akafu is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka period, but his birth and death dates are not known.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「あとのあかふ」で同じ。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name reads "ATO no Akafu," the same as in modern syllabary characters.
In the old Japanese kana syllabary, his name reads "ATO no Akafu," the same as in the modern kana syllabary.
sen.cmt: 他のファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese kana syllabary, his name reads "ATO no Akafu," the same as in the modern kana syllabary.
Ato's "kabane" name, a hereditary title which describes his family's relationship with the central government, was "Muraji."
Ato's "kabane" name, a hereditary title which describes his family's relationship with the central government, was "Muraji."
Ato's "kabane" name, a hereditary title which describes his family's relationship with the central government, was "Muraji."

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）に従い、東海道に軍の動員を命じる使者になった。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War in 672, Ato took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and became a messenger to mobilize troops from the Tokaido region.
During the Jinshin War of 672, Ato took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and became a messenger to mobilize troops from the Tokaido region.
sen.cmt: 前置詞を修正しました。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War of 672, Ato took side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama, who later became Emperor Tenmu), and became a messenger to mobilize troops from the Tokaido region.

sen.j: 安斗氏は物部氏の系列に属する氏族である。
sen.e: Ato uji (clan) is a family which belongs to the lineage of the Mononobe clan.
The Ato clan was a family which belonged to the lineage of the Mononobe clan.
sen.cmt: ujiは不要と考え削除し、過去形に修正しました。
sen.e: The Ato clan was a family which belonged to the lineage of the Mononobe clan.

sen.j: 壬申の乱を起こした大海人皇子は、6月26日までにまず美濃国と伊勢国が味方についたことを知った。
sen.e: Oama no Miko, who broke out the Jinshin War, learned by June 26 that the Provinces of Mino and Ise decided to take Oama's side.
Oama no Miko, who caused the Jinshin War, learned by June 26 that the Provinces of Mino and Ise decided to take Oama's side.
sen.cmt: broke out を causedに修正しました。
sen.e: Oama no Miko, who caused the Jinshin War, learned by June 26 that the Provinces of Mino and Ise decided to take Oama's side.

sen.j: そこで伊勢国朝明郡の郡家から、さらに東海（東海道）と東山（東山道）の軍を発するための使者を遣わした。
sen.e: Then, Prince Oama dispatched messengers from Kori no miyake (public office) in Asake no Kori in the Province of Ise to mobilize troops from the Tokaido and Tosando regions.
Then, Prince Oama dispatched messengers from Kori no miyake (public office) in Asake no Kori in the Province of Ise to mobilize troops from the Tokaido and Tosando regions.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Then, Prince Oama dispatched messengers from Kori no miyake (public office) in Asake no Kori in the Province of Ise to mobilize troops from the Tokaido and Tosando regions.

sen.j: 山背部小田と安斗阿加布が東海への使者になった。
sen.e: YAMASHIROBE no Oda and ATO no Akafu were sent to the Tokaido region.
YAMASHIROBE no Oda and ATO no Akafu were sent to the Tokaido region.
YAMASHIROBE no Oda and ATO no Akafu were sent to the Tokaido region.

sen.j: 彼等は無事に任務を果たしたらしい。
sen.e: They seem to have performed their assignment without failure.
They seem to have performed their assignment without failure.
They seem to have performed their assignment without failure.

sen.j: 安斗阿加布については他に記録がない。
sen.e: There are no other records about Ato.
There are no other records about Ato.
There are no other records about Ato.
